main event: A very bright light was observed over San Francisco by a woman on August 6, 1952.
interesting points: The object was described as round, with a diameter estimated to be 25-30 feet,It emitted a dull, orange-red glow,The object moved erratically at a rapid speed, changing direction several times,The Naval Station nearby was conducting training in the area,Weather conditions were reported as normal with no meteorological anomalies.
sighted object: a very bright round light emitting an orange-red glow
witness description: Mr. Lewis V. Westhook, Assistant Director of Intel, 9th Air Division and a ground observer
